articles.author: Jan Gerber
articles.title: Govt urges South Africans not to 'pick sides' in Russia's bloody invasion of Ukraine - News24
articles.description: The government has urged South Africans "not to take sides" in Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
articles.content:

articles.title: Netflix-Unesco short film competition: Meet the winners from Africa - Africanews English
articles.description: Six filmmakers from sub-Saharan Africa have won a short film competition by Unesco and Netflix on the theme "reinvented African folktales".
articles.content:

articles.title: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei breaks Scott Kelly's spaceflight record - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: NASA officials say the record-breaking astronaut is returning to Earth aboard a Russian Soyuz spaceship, despite tensions between the US and Russia.
articles.content:
NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei has broken the record for longest US human spaceflight, a title former astronaut Scott Kelly has held since 2016.

articles.title: Pushback against South Africa’s extended state of disaster - BusinessTech
articles.description: The government’s decision to further extend South Africa’s national state of disaster until 15 April 2022 has been met by significant resistance by opposition parties, businesses, and civil society groups – and now faces a raft of legal challenges.

articles.title: Facebook to be prosecuted in South Africa - BusinessTech
articles.description: The Competition Commission has referred to the Competition Tribunal for the prosecution of the social media giant, Meta Platforms, and its subsidiaries, WhatsApp Inc and Facebook South Africa for abuse of dominance.

articles.title: Tuesday's weather: Heavy rain for Mpumalanga, Limpopo and Gauteng - News24
articles.description: The South African Weather Service has issued a yellow level 2 warning for disruptive rain expected over Mpumalanga's Lowveld and Highveld, the south-central and south-west of Limpopo, and the northern parts of Gauteng.

articles.title: Large, long-lived, and entirely molten magma chambers once existed in Earth's crust - Science Daily
